definition: Destiny is inexorable, there is no fleeing it (idiom). Your doom is at hand.
to rob/to plunder/to seize by force/to coerce/calamity/abbr. for kalpa 劫波[jie2 bo1]
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: If the two forward combination Shuangjian, Belgium Jieshuo will not be able to escape.
sentences.chinese: 这两名前锋如果双剑合璧，比利时将劫数难逃。

sentences.english: Everything is more beautiful because we're doomed.
sentences.chinese: 万物变得更美因为注定劫数难逃。

sentences.english: But today, we cannot escape our doomed fate.

definition: everything bodes ill, no positive signs (idiom); inauspicious/everything points to disaster
to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
facing imminent catastrophe/calamity looms/all hell will break loose
to be facing imminent calamity (idiom)/disaster is looming
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: lit. even given wings, you couldn't fly (idiom); fig. impossible to escape
to divulge the will of heaven (idiom); to leak a secret/to let the cat out of the bag
